title.rendered: The next Minecraft mob could be the Glare

content.rendered:
Mojang has announced the first contender that could be Minecraft’s next monster, the Glare, a floating bush with eyes.

While it has the potential to look like nightmare fuel due to its traits, the Glare is actually a surprisingly endearing and remarkably helpful mob, alerting players to areas dark enough for monsters to spawn with a Whistling Blow.

Smart gamers will already know that Minecraft already has some of this functionality, because by pressing F3 to access the debug screen in the game’s Java editions, you can see the light value of the block you’re currently on . As long as the light value is greater than 7, you are in the clear as no enemy monsters can spawn.

While the debug screen already makes glare a bit redundant, glare has a few benefits, such as the ability to hover over otherwise passable dark areas, while still being pretty adorable. This should make the Glare a useful companion when mining or crafting as long as it is added to the game.

In the blog post, Mojang announced that Glare will be one of the three potential monsters that could be added to Minecraft, so expect to hear about the other two possible monsters soon, as Mojang will likely announce them beforehand.

Minecraft Live is slated to begin later this week on October 16 at 5:00pm ET / XNUMX:XNUMX PM BST, so drop by if you get a chance to vote on the next crowd to come to Minecraft.
